io.spine.server.aggregate

Class AggregateStorage<I>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.server.storage.AbstractStorage<I,io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateStateRecord,AggregateReadRequest<I>>
      • io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateStorage<I>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - the type of IDs of aggregates managed by this storage
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Storage<I,io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateStateRecord,AggregateReadRequest<I>>, StorageWithLifecycleFlags<I,io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateStateRecord,AggregateReadRequest<I>>, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    @SPI
public abstract class AggregateStorage<I>
extends AbstractStorage<I,io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateStateRecord,AggregateReadRequest<I>>
implements StorageWithLifecycleFlags<I,io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateStateRecord,AggregateReadRequest<I>>
    An event-sourced storage of aggregate part events and snapshots.

      • checkNotClosed

        protected void checkNotClosed()
                       throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Ensures the storage is not closed.

        If the storage is closed throws IllegalStateException.

        Opens the method for the package.

        Overrides:
        checkNotClosed in class AbstractStorage<I,io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateStateRecord,AggregateReadRequest<I>>
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the storage is closed

      • read

        public java.util.Optional<io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateStateRecord> read(AggregateReadRequest<I> request)
        Forms and returns an AggregateStateRecord based on the aggregate history.
        Specified by:
        read in interface Storage<I,io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateStateRecord,AggregateReadRequest<I>>
        Parameters:
        request - the aggregate read request based on which to form a record
        Returns:
        the record instance or Optional.empty() if the aggregate history is empty
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the storage was closed before

      • write

        public void write(I id,
                  io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateStateRecord events)
        Writes events into the storage.

        NOTE: does not rewrite any events. Several events can be associated with one aggregate ID.

        Specified by:
        write in interface Storage<I,io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateStateRecord,AggregateReadRequest<I>>
        Parameters:
        id - the ID for the record
        events - non empty aggregate state record to store

      • readEventCountAfterLastSnapshot

        protected abstract int readEventCountAfterLastSnapshot(I id)
        Reads a count of events which were saved to the storage after the last snapshot was created, or a count of all events if there were no snapshots yet.
        Parameters:
        id - an ID of an aggregate
        Returns:
        an even count after the last snapshot

      • writeEventCountAfterLastSnapshot

        protected abstract void writeEventCountAfterLastSnapshot(I id,
                                                         int eventCount)
        Writes a count of events which were saved to the storage after the last snapshot was created, or a count of all events if there were no snapshots yet.
        Parameters:
        id - an ID of an aggregate
        eventCount - an even count after the last snapshot
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the storage is closed

      • writeRecord

        protected abstract void writeRecord(I id,
                                    io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateEventRecord record)
        Writes the passed record into the storage.
        Parameters:
        id - the aggregate ID
        record - the record to write

      • historyBackward

        protected abstract java.util.Iterator<io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateEventRecord> historyBackward(AggregateReadRequest<I> request)
        Creates iterator of aggregate event history with the reverse traversal.

        Records are sorted by timestamp descending (from newer to older). The iterator is empty if there's no history for the aggregate with passed ID.

        Parameters:
        request - the read request
        Returns:
        new iterator instance
